name: Victor Shengli Sheng
content: Victor S. Sheng Victor S. Sheng Associate Professor Department of Computer Science Texas Tech University victor.sheng@ttu.edu FOR PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS TA/RA positions in PhD program I am looking for self-motivated, creative and hard-working Ph.D. students. Please feel free to email me (victor.sheng@ttu.edu) your CV if you are interested in my research. TTU is a Carnegie Research I (R1) university. RESEARCH INTERESTS Crowdsourcing Data Mining and Machine Learning Spatial Information Retrieval Data Security Decision Support Applications in Business, Health Informatics, and Software Engineering RESEARCH FUNDINGS Improving Data Quality and Data Mining Using Noisy Micro-Outsourcing. National Science Foundation, PI, (2011 - 2017) $355,628. Welcome to join the PROJECT . University of Central Arkansas start-up funding, (2010 - ). $14,000. NSERC Postdoctoral Fellowship (Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada, like NSF in U.S., total $80,000), September 2007 - August 2009. NSERC Post-graduate Scholarship (total $63,000), May 2005 - April 2008. EDUCATION NSERC Postdoctoral Fellow Leonard N. Stern School of Business, New York University, USA September 2007 - August 2009 Ph.D., Computer Science The University of Western Ontario, London, Ontario, Canada August 2007 M.Sc., Computer Science University of New Brunswick, Fredericton, New Brunswick, Canada December 2003 M.Sc.E., Computer Engineering Suzhou University, Suzhou, Jiangsu, China July 1999 HONOURS AND AWARDS Student Best Paper Award Finalist, The Sixteenth International Conference on Web Information System Engineering (WISE 2015) Best Paper Award, 11th Industrial Conference on Data Mining ICDM, 2011 Best Paper Award Runner-Up, ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (KDD08), 2008 Best Poster Award, The UW and IEEE Kitchener-Waterloo Section Joint Workshop on Knowledge and Data Mining (2006), University of Waterloo, ON, Canada PUBLICATIONS Google Scholar DBLP and DBLP Research Gate ResearcherID
